message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This paper utilizes microdata from the National Longitudinal Survey of Youth 1979 (NLSY79) and its supplements to provide a comprehensive analysis of the long-term effects of early life exposure to air pollution on cognitive development and human capital formation.", "dataset": ["National Longitudinal Survey of Youth 1979 (NLSY79)"]}, {"sentence": "We examine this issue using district-level data on electricity consumption obtained from the National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA).", "dataset": ["National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA)"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on comprehensive, panel dataset containing disaggregated data on health center inputs and outputs for all public and private health facilities in Uganda from 2003 to 2010.", "dataset": ["panel dataset on health center inputs and outputs in Uganda"]}, {"sentence": "We use cross-country data from the OECD Framework for the Assessment of Environment Indicators (OECD) from 2000 to 2016 to perform our analysis on environmental sustainability.", "dataset": ["OECD Framework for the Assessment of Environment Indicators (OECD)"]}, {"sentence": "Our study is based on panel data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys (WBES), which is an extensive dataset collected in partnership with various survey organizations covering more than 130 countries over the period 2002-2017.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys (WBES)"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset on patent filings by inventors at USPTO and EPO from 1998 to 2010 along with the number of citations received by each of these patents to investigate the relationship between inward FDI and innovation performance.", "dataset": ["USPTO patent filings", "EPO patent filings"]}, {"sentence": "We use synthetic control methods and a unique dataset of satellite measurements from NASA's Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) to estimate the causal impact of air pollution on public health in India.", "dataset": ["NASA's Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS)"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze household survey data from multiple rounds of the Ghana Living Standards Survey (GLSS), providing a rich dataset consisting of information on income, assets, consumption and expenditures from 1991 to 2016.", "dataset": ["Ghana Living Standards Survey (GLSS)"]}, {"sentence": "Our study draws on nationally representative individual-level panel data from the German Socio-Economic Panel Study (SOEP) covering the period 1984 to 2017 to analyze the effects of non-cognitive skills on labor market outcomes.", "dataset": ["German Socio-Economic Panel Study (SOEP)"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data from the Mozambique National Agricultural Sample Survey (NASS), we demonstrate the significant negative impacts of exposure to droughts and floods on agricultural production.", "dataset": ["Mozambique National Agricultural Sample Survey (NASS)"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This paper utilizes microdata from the National Longitudinal Survey of Youth 1979 (NLSY79) and its supplements to provide a comprehensive analysis of the long-term effects of
